title: Find Ratios of Consecutive Terms
text: To determine if a sequence is geometric, we find the ratio of the consecutive terms shown.

title: Ratio Between 3 and 12
text: What is the common ratio between 3 and 12? Effectively, what is $$\frac{12}{3}$$?

title: Ratio Between 12 and 48
text: What is the common ratio between 12 and 48? Effectively, what is $$\frac{48}{12}$$?

title: Ratio Between 48 and 192
text: What is the common ratio between 48 and 192? Effectively, what is $$\frac{192}{48}$$?

title: Ratio Between 192 and 768
text: What is the common ratio between 192 and 768? Effectively, what is $$\frac{768}{192}$$?

title: Ratio Between 768 and 3072
text: What is the common ratio between 768 and 3072? Effectively, what is $$\frac{3072}{768}$$?

hintAnswer: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=4$$.
title: Determining Commonality in Ratios
text: Are the ratios between consecutive terms common?
choices: Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=2$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=4$$.
Yes, the series is geometric. The common ratio is $$r=\frac{1}{3}$$.
No, the series is not geometric.
